content.description: Enter and squirm up chimney with a few nice edges to keep things civil.  Clip bolt and ponder the exit to access the face above.  A fall from above the first bolt may be a grounder depending on where you take flight.  Clip three more bolts with the final crux near the top.  The bolting will keep those accustomed to clips every 4 feet on edge.
content.location: The very distinct and obvious chimney that splits the summit.  The route lies on the south side of the formation and all the bolts can be seen from the ground, the first one in the chimney.

content.description: Crux may be entering the chimney but the rock is great and the moves are fun.  Up chimney and follow crack out left to summit.  Not sure where the 5.6 move is but nonetheless a neat and easy way up to the summit.
content.protection: Cams to #3.  Rap anchors on summit.
content.location: Route starts on north side of formation and right of the main chimney.

content.description: The big split summit that you will see from many vantage points along the Marcus Landslide Trail.  There are currently three routes on the formation, a ravens nest, and two rusty bolts on the summit.
